title.narrative: Provision of emergency CCCM support to IDPs displaced by conflict in Borno State

description.narrative: The proposed 6 months project aims at provision of emergency CCCM assistance to conflict affected IDPs living in formal camps and informal settlements in Borno State through two dedicated static CCCM teams. Almost half of Borno’s IDP population live in camps or camp like settings. Despite this, the resources for CCCM are currently inadequate, leading to living standards in camps which are below SPHERE standards, lack of coordination on camp level and lack of an existing referral system for beneficiaries to accommodate especially the most vulnerable protection cases. The lack of existing reception site causes a lack of information about IDP movements and camp populations as well as inadequate cover of the needs in the camps. The proposed project is part of ACTED’s wider programming in the target area. ACTED currently implements a shelter and NFI project in Mafa and existing stocks will be distributed to new arrivals in the reception center proposed under this grant request. It is further linked to a second grant request submitted under this NHF allocation which aims at prepositioning shelter and NFI at the Custom House area. The proposed project will strengthen camp coordination mechanisms and site facilitation in Borno state through the construction and operationalization of reception sites which will provide a clear referral pathway for beneficiaries in order to ensure that sensitive cases are being referred to the correct partner in a swift and respectable manner, it will improve the camp infrastructure through urgently needed site upgrades and the establishment of camp committees and lastly it will build capacity of communities and local authorities on CCCM. ACTED will deploy two dedicated camp management teams to the two proposed locations. ACTED is proposing to implement this project in Mafa LGA and Custom House area in Jere LGA targeting together 35,000 beneficiaries. The locations have been identified in close consultation with other CCCM actors namely IOM and Intersos and the shelter/NFI/DMS sector and complement ACTED’s ongoing operations.
